document.heading: Washington Convention Center Authority Oversight and Management Continuity Amendment Act of 2002

history.narrative: Law 14-184, the “Washington Convention Center Authority Oversight and Management Continuity Amendment Act of 2002”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-521, which was referred to the Committee on Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 7, 2002, and June 4, 2002, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 21, 2002, it was assigned Act No. 14-384 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-184 became effective on October 1, 2002.
